user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex:
```c
int32 OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex(osal_objtype_t idtype, osal_id_t object_id, osal_index_t *ArrayIndex)
{
    uint32         max_id;
    uint32         obj_index;
    osal_objtype_t actual_type;
    int32          return_code;

    /* Check Parameters */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(ArrayIndex);

    obj_index   = OS_ObjectIdToSerialNumber_Impl(object_id);
    actual_type = OS_ObjectIdToType_Impl(object_id);

    /*
     * If requested by the caller, enforce that the ID is of the correct type.
     * If the caller passed OS_OBJECT_TYPE_UNDEFINED, then anything is allowed.
     */
    if (idtype != OS_OBJECT_TYPE_UNDEFINED && actual_type != idtype)
    {
        return_code = OS_ERR_INVALID_ID;
    }
    else
    {
        max_id = OS_GetMaxForObjectType(actual_type);
        if (max_id == 0)
        {
            return_code = OS_ERR_INVALID_ID;
        }
        else
        {
            return_code = OS_SUCCESS;
            *ArrayIndex = OSAL_INDEX_C(obj_index % max_id);
        }
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex:
#define OS_CHECK_POINTER(ptr) BUGCHECK((ptr)!=NULL,OS_INVALID_POINTER)
...
#define OSAL_INDEX_C(X) ((osal_index_t)(X))
...
typedef uint32 osal_objtype_t
...
typedef uint32 osal_id_t
...
typedef uint32 osal_index_t
...
typedef uint32_t  uint32
...
typedef int32_t   int32
...
static inline uint32 OS_ObjectIdToSerialNumber_Impl(osal_id_t id)
{
    return (OS_ObjectIdToInteger(id) & OS_OBJECT_INDEX_MASK);
}
...
static inline osal_objtype_t OS_ObjectIdToType_Impl(osal_id_t id)
{
    return (OS_ObjectIdToInteger(id) >> OS_OBJECT_TYPE_SHIFT);
}
...
uint32 OS_GetMaxForObjectType(osal_objtype_t idtype)
{
    switch (idtype)
    {
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TASK:
            return OS_MAX_TASKS;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_QUEUE:
            return OS_MAX_QUEUES;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_BINSEM:
            return OS_MAX_BIN_SEMAPHORES;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_COUNTSEM:
            return OS_MAX_COUNT_SEMAPHORES;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_MUTEX:
            return OS_MAX_MUTEXES;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_STREAM:
            return OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_FILES;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_DIR:
            return OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_DIRS;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMEBASE:
            return OS_MAX_TIMEBASES;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMECB:
            return OS_MAX_TIMERS;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_MODULE:
            return OS_MAX_MODULES;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_FILESYS:
            return OS_MAX_FILE_SYSTEMS;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONSOLE:
            return OS_MAX_CONSOLES;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONDVAR:
            return OS_MAX_CONDVARS;
        default:
            return 0;
    }
}
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_UNDEFINED 0x00
...
#define OS_ERR_INVALID_ID (-16)
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No explicit compiler-specific language extensions (for example: __attribute__, __asm__, __builtin_*, typeof, statement-expressions ({...}), zero-length arrays, or GCC/Clang-specific keywords like __extension__) are present directly in the shown function OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex or in the other straightforward constructs (typedefs, standard integer types, switch/case, casts, arithmetic, return statements, and simple macros like OSAL_INDEX_C). The fragments selected are places where implementation-hidden macros or functions could introduce compiler extensions: the BUGCHECK macro (used by OS_CHECK_POINTER), OS_ObjectIdToInteger, OS_OBJECT_INDEX_MASK and OS_OBJECT_TYPE_SHIFT (used by the inline helpers), and the calls/cast that use those helpers/macros. These locations should be inspected because their definitions (not provided here) might use compiler-specific extensions. All other visible code constructs in the provided snippets are standard C and do not by themselves indicate use of compiler language extensions, so they do not need further investigation for Rule 1.2 based on the provided material.
